title: Project 2019 Skins Jinx & Pyke Teaser

embed.description: NEW PROJECT SKINS 2019 TEASER - Project Jinx & Project Pyke LEAKED. LoL League of Legends new project skins 2019. We can't control the monsters we create. 🔶Join our Qlub and earn skins from challenges: http://bit.ly/remusqb 🔔K/DA AKALI COSPLAY AT 100K SUBS: http://bit.ly/RemusSub 💛Support me: http://www.patreon.com/Remus 🔷I'm part of the official League Partner Program with Riot Games.

body: Do you think there will only be those 2?

replies.body:
I cannot comprehend the favouritism Riot has about Pyke. Not only is he always overbuffed, but he is also getting ANOTHER SKIN AFTER HE GOT BLOODMOON IN JANUARY THIS YEAR?

But it's alright. I'll wait untill 2087 for the new Xerath chroma.

https://gamepedia.cursecdn.com/overwatch_gamepedia/thumb/d/d5/Spray_Moira_Facepalm.png/100px-Spray_Moira_Facepalm.png?version=504e0399e97f7050b24030aa278d28cc

Popular champs, sell. That's all there is too it.  Plus they have most of the skins planned out about a year in advance as they have a meeting on that and see what themes they want to bring back, who will fit them, ect.

Xerath, doesn't seem to sell much so of course he's not part of anything :/

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-07-13T19:13:02.296+0000)
>
> Popular champs, sell. That's all there is too it.  Plus they have most of the skins planned out about a year in advance as they have a meeting on that and see what themes they want to bring back, who will fit them, ect.
> 
> Xerath, doesn't seem to sell much so of course he's not part of anything :/

Yes but its called having at least a little respect for your audience and at least pretending you care about trying to spread out skin releases, it was bad enough already with the stupid Star Child Champs getting basically annual skins every other year but no Riot cant be outdone, so now we get this junk, Bi Yearly, Tri Yearly skin releases for those popular champs instead of letting any other champ maybe get a chance at the spotline.


Crazy idea, maybe some champions don't sell skins because they are left in a dumpster half a season or because the meager pool of skins they do get are underwhelming in most regards. Like Riot is a big company, it it really that hard for them to bite the bullet and maybe give some c List champs a legendary skin, just to see what will happen.


Honestly if this is Pyke its just another tick on the mounting pool of evidence that this year is Riot's year of damage control because Daddy Tencent is not happy with last years profits. Events that are basically underwhelming reskins of each other with the same buy in prize pass, with all the extra bells and whistles dropped. A new Gamemode chasing the Autochess craze that is replacing RGM, while conveniently having something those other games lack, a gambling monetization system (While of course being clearly incomplete with how much arbitrary obscuring of knowledge occurs in it) . Every skin like getting a overpriced Chroma that is sold as some sort of valuable thing and the unprecedented amount of bias that is being thrown towards their popular champs, Kaisai getting a skin every 6 months. Pyke with a skin every 6 months now. The Skin vote going to Tristana instead of a more obscure champion, Lux and Ez double dipping on a Anime Motif since they cant quite do Star Guardians 2, yet. Yasuo getting his yearly skin of course, cant quite fit him in, that's fine just shove him into Battle Boss. Jhin got his legendary because of the eternal tragedy of being on break for a year. Shoot even the fact that most champions release skins now are part of a skin line seems to indicate a slight desperation to make them sell. Even the champs releases this year feel kinda arbitrarily safe. With Sylas,Qiyana and Yuumi kinda not being super interesting (Prisoner chained and starved, still comes out more chiseled then his gauntlets. Princess heralding a new culture, so naturally just kinda aesthetically looks like a supermodel with no real aesthetic distinction for other factions except like, white hair, and Yuumi is well, she is a cat, with a book, i sorta wished that she was a new Yordle.)


Overall its sorta why i didn't want them to revisit these lines this year, because i wanted to see events with these lines (Arcade,Project,Star Guardian) not the same god damm "buy the pass" Sales pitch that has been every bloody '''''event''''' this year.

>Yes but its called having at least a little respect for your audience and at least pretending you care about trying to spread out skin releases

If they did that, then Ivern for example could have had a far better skin then Dunkmaster. But it's pretty clear they don't care even when they do give lower selling champs a skin.

>Crazy idea, maybe some champions don't sell skins because they are left in a dumpster half a season or because the meager pool of skins they do get are underwhelming in most regards

I dunno about that. Azir was pretty much left in the gutter cause of pro play but still got skins alongside that which were still pretty nicely done. Kalista or Taliyah on the other hand have suffered from the "esports only skin" syndrome. So I guess that goes either way when left in a dumpster state.


And now with the latest trailer showing off Pyke, Jinx, Akali and Irelia, then hinting at Warwick, it's pretty clear it's another event line that is alllll about that money. So they sure as hell just pushed for a lot of popular champions this year on skins and very very few of the lower champs. I mean, considering the champion list of promised skins this year was Zilean, Nunu, Shaco and Ivern, we could kind of already tell there were going to be a high volume of popular skins coming. Unlike last years where they had like 10+ champs that had waited for skins and they handed those out to them.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-14T16:10:32.018+0000)
>
> If they did that, then Ivern for example could have had a far better skin then Dunkmaster. But it's pretty clear they don't care even when they do give lower selling champs a skin.
> 
> I dunno about that. Azir was pretty much left in the gutter cause of pro play but still got skins alongside that which were still pretty nicely done. Kalista or Taliyah on the other hand have suffered from the "esports only skin" syndrome. So I guess that goes either way when left in a dumpster state.
> 
> 
> And now with the latest trailer showing off Pyke, Jinx, Akali and Irelia, then hinting at Warwick, it's pretty clear it's another event line that is alllll about that money. So they sure as hell just pushed for a lot of popular champions this year on skins and very very few of the lower champs. I mean, considering the champion list of promised skins this year was Zilean, Nunu, Shaco and Ivern, we could kind of already tell there were going to be a high volume of popular skins coming. Unlike last years where they had like 10+ champs that had waited for skins and they handed those out to them.

Once again this is why im cite about how im not at all excited for any skin lines they do this year, because its pretty fucking clear that at least this year, they are going to be all about that bottom line and nothing else. Every popular champ grabbing skins left and right, everyone else left forgotten or with half arsed inclusions. I mean FFS basically all the champs revealed for project have literally gone less then a year before getting this shit, annual skins for some champs was already a problem, but this, this is a joke. Riot just needs to cut out the middle man and outright say they are going to be focusing more on new or popular champs for skin lines. At least then we all know the pretense.


Cant wait for Star Guardian 2019 with 

Star Guardian Kai Sai (With prestige because hey she already triple dips skins so may aswell double dip prestige)
Star Guardian Riven
Star Guardian Lux 2
Star Guardian Irelia
and 
Star Guardian Vayne

I say that Star Guardian is more than likely to have Zoe and Annie cause those are two popular picks we have yet to see this year.  We are getting Irelia in Project so it's unlikely they will pump out another one right after.  Vayne got one for Lunar Revel so I could see her hitting Star Guardian but I dunno.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-15T01:33:15.665+0000)
>
> I say that Star Guardian is more than likely to have Zoe and Annie cause those are two popular picks we have yet to see this year.  We are getting Irelia in Project so it's unlikely they will pump out another one right after.  Vayne got one for Lunar Revel so I could see her hitting Star Guardian but I dunno.

I mean you assume Irelia wont get a new skin pumped out straight after, but Kai Sai says hello, Riot clearly showed as mentioned they don't have much regard for saturation and will follow the green notes wherever it takes them. Annie maybe but Annie's issue is they can bank on her in LCS either and she lacks the standard flashyness of other champs, and i think even Riot realised that no one likes Zoe so they may give her the Azir treatment and ignore her, its hard to tell wether her Pool party skin was a indication of a annual skin, or more of a one off thing.

You have to realize they planned out all of the champions that get skins months in advance (generally a year).  Kai'sa had her K/DA in November then Arcade in June, which were also almost 7 months apart and aren't in the same year. They also planned on having two skins for Pyke, that's why he got one in Blood Moon and is getting a Project next.  So it's not like they are gonna suddenly pump out another one just cause. They only plan a certain amount, and Irelia has yet to actually make that cut of receiving multiple in a year. Very few champions have actually seen two in a year. Pyke and Yi being the only ones I can think of. So, it could happen but I doubt it. Especially two popular skinlines for the SAME champ, in the SAME year.

General skin popularity isn't based around LCS. It's based around the game as a WHOLE. The community.  The most popular champion in the game is Yasuo, it's why he had an Arcade skin, after having an Odyssey skin a year ago.  Annie, already has 11 skins (last being in 2017), so she's still in the popular group. I highly doubt she's gonna suddenly get dropped like the champs that got butchered from proplay and same for Zoe.

Zoe's pool party skin was a pretty clear indication of her popularity. She came out in November of 2017, to then get her first skin by August of 2018 where most of the newer champions before her have either waited at least two years or are STILL waiting.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-15T04:46:56.993+0000)
>
> You have to realize they planned out all of the champions that get skins months in advance (generally a year).  Kai'sa had her K/DA in November then Arcade in June, which were also almost 7 months apart and aren't in the same year. They also planned on having two skins for Pyke, that's why he got one in Blood Moon and is getting a Project next.  So it's not like they are gonna suddenly pump out another one just cause. They only plan a certain amount, and Irelia has yet to actually make that cut of receiving multiple in a year. Very few champions have actually seen two in a year. Pyke and Yi being the only ones I can think of. So, it could happen but I doubt it. Especially two popular skinlines for the SAME champ, in the SAME year.
> 
> General skin popularity isn't based around LCS. It's based around the game as a WHOLE. The community.  The most popular champion in the game is Yasuo, it's why he had an Arcade skin, after having an Odyssey skin a year ago.  Annie, already has 11 skins (last being in 2017), so she's still in the popular group. I highly doubt she's gonna suddenly get dropped like the champs that got butchered from proplay and same for Zoe.
> 
> Zoe's pool party skin was a pretty clear indication of her popularity. She came out in November of 2017, to then get her first skin by August of 2018 where most of the newer champions before her have either waited at least two years or are STILL waiting.

Again its the fundamental question of why these champions get constant consideration for planning when other champs have gone in excess of 2 years for their own. Yes Kai Sai was not in the same year, that should not matter though, the fact is she was getting skins every 6 months and that is not even factoring in her E Sports skin (It requires resources to develop, and its still a skin so im counting it), and again why is Pyke being considered eligible for skins when his already gained one with Bloodmoon. Yes its all planned in advanced by as mentioned at the end of the day, these champs are getting a huge concentration of skins in comparison and for all we know they do already have more Kai Sai and Pyke skins in the pipeline.

The issue is the fact these champs are considered for skins so soon after their last ones in the first place, it raises the questions of "If Riot is okay with them getting skins this quick, then how many other skin discussion were they part of, how many other eligible champs were pushed out because "Kai Sai has shown to sell well according to last years metrics", again its the issue of if they are okay with 2 a year, why not 3, if the champ sells well and how long until this bleeds over, how long until we start seeing the other popular champs filling in 2 roles within half a year"

I cited not annie mainly because she lacks the flash, as mentioned and it seems at least currently Riot is trying to double down on profiting off the flashey champs, Yes Annie is popular, but is she as popular as Akali or other equivalent champs that have more ''''exciting'''' gameplay. Believe me i would not Mind Annie, if nothing else despite her saturation she still lacks a decent Legendary and heaven knows she can use a skin that gives her more then 10 voicelines.

My Point about Zoe is more that Riot seems to be generally ignoring her, they may give her a skin since unlike Annie she does have that flasheyness to it, but its sorta unclear wether they are going to push her more like Yasuo, or back off on her like Azir, especially since Akali is feeding the 'Busted CertT champ that sells skins' quite nicely for them. So we may have to see, if she does get a Skin this year, then she is probably in that Annual Skin boat, if she does not, they may just be trying to hide her.


My point is more about the pretense of the situation, that the fact champs are considered for multiple skins within half a year sets up the idea that this can become a more constant thing and that champs who used to do the annual rounds will now start taking up more slots that could reasonably be used on other champs, causing stuff like these team skinlines to start being taken up by not just a popular frontliner but also then other popular champs aswell. I mentioned in another thread this whole notion of 'popular champ tax' where every skinline can start being taxed by having multiply entries being taken up by one or more of this Bi Yearly champs.
*kaisa has entered the chat*
Pyke has a 48% winrate....overbuffed is probably the farthest thing from how one should describe that champ.
Pyke always overbuffed? xd They recently killed him as a sololaner hahaha and as supp rn he's actually not that great..
Except that Pyke literally just had all his roles besides support gutted, and he has 3 skins with the addition of this one?
Boi they nerfed Pyke from ever solo laning by removing any wave clear potential.

I know I will probably get hate for saying this but I would rather see someone else get PROJECT skins this year. Since **MONSTROSITY** is taking the prime focus in terms of direction here are my suggestive candidates...

{{champion:110}} {{champion:429}} 

You might think that i'm being biased at first but I promise there's really an idea as to why specifically those two. Both of them went through a journey (in their Lores) were they were both Human, and then later become something far more sinister. But they both share a similar purpose: they both inflict CHAOS for two seperate reasons.

Varus is causing destruction and is fueled by revenge, and seeks **RETRIBUTION** for what came of his brethren. Kalista endlessly pursues anyone and everyone who has broken oaths, betrayed, or has a lot of blood on their hands in general, and she brings **VENGEANCE**. Looking at both of these goals, it is what made and still is making them **MONSTROUS** with each step of the way.

So that's why I think this new PROJECT skin like should be called...

* ##PROJECT://_C͜Ǫ҉͘R̵Ŕ҉U̴̵P̶͘TÈ҉D

> 

I just don't see how both Jinx and Pyke (who are more human) can be more Monstrous than Varus and Kalista.

Additionally, both Jinx and Pyke follow more of a madness role, than a **MONSTROUS** one. And as someone else has said it before already, Pyke still got a skin quite recently. 

If not Varus then Kalista, she deserves a Skin considering she only has one non LCS themed Skin.

> 

Just imagine even if it was like a mini VS during this PROJECT event, between these two...

#{{champion:110}} R̴E̶̛ŢR͟͢IB̛ÙT̵̶̕I̧͟҉Ǫ̕͜N͘ [vs] V̵͜͡ÈN̕͏G̶͡E̷À͝N̸C͏̨̕E {{champion:429}}

> [{quoted}](name=Darkin Hybrid,realm=EUW,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-07-13T19:06:17.818+0000)
>
> I know I will probably get hate for saying this but I would rather see someone else get PROJECT skins this year. Since **MONSTROSITY** is taking the prime focus in terms of direction here are my suggestive candidates...
> 
> {{champion:110}} {{champion:429}} 


Hurr durr. Let's talk monstrous but ignore the champions that are actual **monsters**.

{{champion:421}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:120}} 

Yes, I get it. Project is supposed to be an augmented humanoid series.


{{champion:120}} Would fit easily, due to being a centaur. Some sort of cyber centaur, make the bottom half vehicle (rather than horse) based.

{{champion:421}} could fit as a rogue AI that cobbled together a form / took something over. Or, to really go above and beyond, make her a militarized stasis unit; with someone inside of her long insectile tail, similar to how 40k dreadnaughts work.

{{champion:56}} could be similar to Zed, but less ninja and more cyber-image / projection.

{{champion:19}} Could fit just as well as anyone else, all that you really need is a wolf head / helmet aug.

But no. Instead, lets just shove more skins onto champions that already have plenty, like Jinx and Pyke. And when we try to play around MONSTROSITY as a over-arching concept, let's clearly just pick more half-dressed humanoids. Fuck the actual monsters. :^)

They can't just break the pattern of the skin line just because the theme is a little different...

* PROJECT - consists of only Human Figures (Vi, Yi).
* PROGRAM - consists of Magically altered Entities (Lissandra, Soraka).
* MECHA - consists of mostly monster like Entities (Sion, Urgot).

Each of your mentioned Champions would go in the following categories...

* PROJECT: N/A
* PROGRAM: Nocturne (he is more on the Magical side with some Human shape familiarities, and he's a wraith without a proper physical body so I think PROGRAM would be more fitting)
* MECHA: Warwick, Hecarim

Cho'Gath has a MECHA skin and Rek'Sai has a Eternum Skin which is similar to MECHA.

Rek'sai has Eternum not Mecha.

Rek'sai has only 2 skins, Eternum and Pool Party.

> [{quoted}](name=Rylalei,realm=EUNE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=0001000300010000,timestamp=2019-07-14T16:07:31.601+0000)
>
> Rek'sai has Eternum not Mecha.
> 
> Rek'sai has only 2 skins, Eternum and Pool Party.

Yeah my bad, was in a rush typing it.

Jinx and Pyke will most likely be rogue units. 

Considering their lores i expect 

Jinx to be a unit that went "berserk" and is on a path of destruction and mayhem. Considering the distopian setting she won't just be playing pranks anymore. 

Pyke to be either a hacked unit or one affected by a virus. Considering pykes lore where he was influenced by the monsters he hunted. Hunting higher ups in the organization that created him.


neither unit would fit into the rebeling unit faction as they're lone wolf character types.
this would also fit the saying "of a monster we created" and would still fit in with the corruption theme.


i honestly think varus could be a great addition to the project line but i'd rather see him being only "half done" and having his human mind struggle with the robotic parts overtaking him. this could even work for a battlecast/resistance varus.

(sarcasm)

> [{quoted}](name=Darkin Hybrid,realm=EUW,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-07-13T19:06:17.818+0000)
>
> Both of them went through a journey (in their Lores) were they were both Human, and then later become something far more sinister. But they both share a similar purpose: they both inflict CHAOS for two seperate reasons.

When will people learn that skins are their own universe? A skin doesn't need to "fit" a champion because of his canon lore. **The skin has its own lore**.

{{sticker:sg-lulu}} 

Anyway, I couldn't care less about who gets Project skins. Just stop using the "fits better on champion X" argument.

> When will people learn that skins are their own universe? A skin doesn't need to "fit" a champion because of his canon lore. The skin has its own lore.

It's not only lore, certain skin lines also sometimes feel like they don't fit certain champs because of their base designs or the way their kits work.

For example, they really stretched it by giving Jarvan a Dark Star skin just because of his E and Q combo instead of giving it to someone else who could've made use of the theme better. Imagine Urgot executing someone by pulling them into a black hole that's inside his stomach, for example.

Or how about Battle Boss Yasuo, who instead of looking like a menacing, inhuman being that looks like it somehow walked out of straight out of an arcade machine like all the others in the line, he just looks like some human guy in a weird blue/purple suit. Pretty sure champs like Vel'koz and Xerath with their devastating, long range aoe abilities combined with their already otherworldly appearances could've worked much better for the arcade boss theme.
Darn i really wish i got to see an project {{champion:91}}
He's much more in need and far more fitting for the theme. Don't even play him but it makes sense for him to have a Project one for sure.
I don't think it is only two. There are 3 teasers here. The first is the bullets (Jinx), the second destroys the camera (NA), and finally the third slashes the door (Pyke)
Could be Nocturne, his ult pretty much does some sort of blackout thing.
If it is, then I think that would be the most deserving champ out of the group for it tbh... also kills the idea people have in their heads that it's a human only skin line which I'd be all for.
They could just say that he lost his legs somehow.

are they confirmed?

There was a leak revealing project skins to be for varus (legendary) taliyah MF and tryndamere 

I wasnt sure about this "leak" but when i saw the teaser i thought ok its possibly true

I am ALL for Jinx getting more skins, but the bias is getting disgustingly out of hand.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=243gIhRT,comment-id=000d000000010000,timestamp=2019-07-13T22:12:47.246+0000)
>
> W/E. It's still not like she JUST got one.  it's cause Kali and Tali were overly nerfed cause of Pro play so they won't be seeing anything any time soon really.

That is literally less than a year ago. That's about as soon as it possibly could be - rarely do they come out in a shorter amount of time that this. Meanwhile champions like Zilean, Bard and Skarner haven't had a skin in 3+ years. It is completely irrelevant how unviable they may be. They still have their mains and one tricks. No champion should be left without a new skin for so long when they literally release up to 4 or 5 new skins every single patch.

Zilean has a promised one for this year.   

Yes, none should but unfortunately that's not how it works. Skins revolve around sales, if they are making skins for a champion that sells, Jinx, it's a good business move. If they make multiple for a champion that doesn't sell, Skarner, it's a bad business move.

And Master Yi is proof they can come out way faster since he got two of them 4 months apart in 2017.

Pyke if anything is the one you should complain about cause he literally got one THIS year, and if that teaser is indeed for him then here he is again.

Riot is a multi billion dollar company. We're no longer in a time where skins are the ONLY way Riot makes money. In fact, I don't believe this is even their primary way of making money. This is really just greed on their end as they absolute CAN afford to make skins for more unpopular champs that they know won't sell AS well. It would simply make the mains who do play these champs and would buy these skins extremely happy. Is it fair that I decided that I get fewer skins because I decided to main a less popular champion?

Yes, it's not the only way they get money but it is a major way. If they are making skins for popular champions those are unfortunately going to sell far better than making skins for unpopular champion. It is still about money, they want to continue to bring in their millions in any way they can.

So with the reveal today being Jinx, Pyke, Akali and Irelia (and the fifth hidden skin of Warwick) it's clear that they are pushing those champions on this theme for a lot of money. Just like how the Arcade line had Kaisa, Yasuo and Cait who are also big sellers.

Which is absolutely disgusting. They do not NEED to go for the most popular champions EVERY time. Even if they made it so at least one less popular champion got one of these skins then that would be fine, especially considering some of these champs make much better fits to the skin lines than the ones they've used. Such as Xerath making a much better fit for Dark Star or Arcade than Karma or Yasuo respectively.

I enjoyed the Karma skin myself as I was hoping she'd get a dark toned skin as most all her previous ones are much brighter.  

Yasuo is just a big meh; since for him and qiyana they went with the whole " previously an arcade hero but got corrupt by veigars virus" story. I didn't dislike it but I don't love it. Could have probably gone with someone else.

Xerath, udyr, skarner, and just so many others out there wanting a skin but never get them. Hell, even ornn fell victim to not getting a skin since release and it's been almost 2 years since he came out.

I'm not suggesting the skins are bad - the skin team almost always does a bang up job of making the skins look great, especially when the champion in question has a lot of particles to work with, such as Karma (Arcade Yasuo does look really bad imo). Even these new Project skins look absolutely fantastic, but as you said, so many champions have gone so long without a skin that it becomes truly bothersome to see champions that have had several skins in a short time frame take up slots that they'd be perfect for. Such as giving Xerath a dark star skin, Vel'Koz and arcade skin or Mecha Kalista. Kalista hasn't had a non esports themed skin since her release, which Riot claim they don't count.

Meanwhile champs like Vel'koz and Xerath have been waiting for a couple years now.

Also Jinx got her Odyssey skin in 2018.
